text:
Hey folks! I am new to HubSpot and this is not the right channel to ask but I need some help.

How can I set up HubDB to automatically create pages based on the number of records added, using data inserted from a third-party service?

How can I create a dynamic process where adding records to HubDB automatically generates new pages, reflecting the newly inserted data. I tried using `Enable creation of dynamic pages using row data` but this is creating a single page  but I need pages for all the records.

Is there a way to achieve this or do I have to use the `create site page`  endpoint individually?
Any insights would be helpful. Thanks
Hey <@U070XARFN4W>, did you set up the page in the CMS to use the data source as hubDB? In the settings of the cms page, using your dynamic page template. Sorry if my answer is way off :joy:

Thanks for responding <@U04CC57CMBP> Much appreciated.

I created some test records  in the HubDB then I created a template via Design Manger and the used the HubL to connect it to a page.
This is working fine for one single page. I am trying to generate pages on each record insertion.
Here is the article I followed
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/dynamic-pages/hubdb?_ga=2.101351169.1835874966.1713792557-587380166.1713792557>
Yeah I was referring to this step <@U070XARFN4W>, did you choose the hubdb table in the dropdown on the page in settings, and you do have more than one row in the table?

Hello everyone,
Do any of you have a site developed on the HubSpot CMS? We're currently using Webflow, but as part of our website redesign, I've come across numerous articles highlighting the improvements of the HubSpot CMS. Since we already use HubSpot for Sales/Marketing/Service, having our CMS on HubSpot could presumably allow us to further optimize our site, which is aimed at lead generation.
I'm very keen to hear your feedback!
Thanks a lot :slightly_smiling_face:
